org.apache.paimon.flink.source

Class BaseDataTableSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.paimon.flink.source.FlinkTableSource
      • org.apache.paimon.flink.source.BaseDataTableSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.flink.table.connector.source.abilities.SupportsAggregatePushDown, org.apache.flink.table.connector.source.abilities.SupportsFilterPushDown, org.apache.flink.table.connector.source.abilities.SupportsLimitPushDown, SupportsLookupCustomShuffle, org.apache.flink.table.connector.source.abilities.SupportsProjectionPushDown, org.apache.flink.table.connector.source.abilities.SupportsWatermarkPushDown, org.apache.flink.table.connector.source.DynamicTableSource, org.apache.flink.table.connector.source.LookupTableSource, org.apache.flink.table.connector.source.ScanTableSource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataTableSource

    public abstract class BaseDataTableSource
extends FlinkTableSource
implements org.apache.flink.table.connector.source.LookupTableSource, org.apache.flink.table.connector.source.abilities.SupportsWatermarkPushDown, org.apache.flink.table.connector.source.abilities.SupportsAggregatePushDown, SupportsLookupCustomShuffle
    Table source to create StaticFileStoreSource or ContinuousFileStoreSource under batch mode or streaming mode.

      • getPartitioner

        public Optional<SupportsLookupCustomShuffle.InputDataPartitioner> getPartitioner()
        Description copied from interface: SupportsLookupCustomShuffle
        This method is used to retrieve a custom partitioner that will be applied to the input stream of lookup-join node.
        Specified by:
        getPartitioner in interface SupportsLookupCustomShuffle
        Returns:
        An SupportsLookupCustomShuffle.InputDataPartitioner that defines how records should be distributed across the different subtasks. If the connector expects the input data to remain in its original distribution, an Optional.empty() should be returned.
